title: ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Adrian) - ProMedica Skilled Nursing & Rehabilitation

content.hospiceName: Welcome To ProMedica Skilled Nursing And Rehabilitation (Adrian)
content.title: Your Best Way Home
content.description: Gain the skills and strength you need for a better quality of life at ProMedica Provincial House, located on the campus of ProMedica Bixby Hospital in Adrian, Michigan. Our nursing team works collaboratively with physicians and therapists. You’ll receive a full continuum of 24-hour health care services in our 117-bed facility.

featuresAmenities.content: Emphasis in the design of our facilities is placed on providing optimum functionality in order to help you return home or to a lower level of care.

testimonials.quote: "I am now stronger and more flexible and able to walk on my own safely."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Kathleen's Orthopedic Recovery Story











Patient Profile: 
After a serious accident, Kathleen was admitted to the hospital. She was was severely injured with several broken bones that required surgery. Post-surgery, Kathleen was unable to walk or transfer and was in need of rehabilitation and nursing care before returning home.
Post-acute Need:
Kathleen, 74, lives on her own and gardens extensively. She required physical and occupational therapy to help get her strong enough to transfer and walk on her own. She was in severe pain and had surgical incisions that required care.
Post-acute Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Kathleen meet her goals. The nursing team helped Kathleen manager her pain and taught her about caring for her incisions. The therapy team helped Kathleen work on strengthening, balance and range of motion so she would feel confident returning home. The team did a home assessment to ensure Kathleen was confident in her ability to get around on her own.
Back to Active:



'When I first arrived I wasn't able to do much on my own. It was important to me to be able to get around independently since I was doing everything for myself before my accident. I am now stronger and more flexible and able to walk on my own safely.' - Kathleen



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quote: "After my rehab stay, I am back home and comfortable being on my own and taking care of myself."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Russell's Cardiac Recovery Story











Patient Profile:
Russell is a 68 year old male with a history of heart disease. After experiencing a heart attack, Russell underwent heart surgery. His doctor recommended post-acute skilled nursing and rehabilitation services before returning home.
Post-hospital Need:
Russell lives on his own in a split level house and was independent before his heart attack. He needed strengthening to climb his steps safely and make lifestyle adjustments. He also needed to improve his ability to care for his daily needs such as preparing meals, dressing and bathing.
Post-hospital Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Russell meet his goals. The nursing team took care of Russell's wound, taught him about wound care and medication management. The therapy team worked with Russell to regain strength so he could use the steps at home. He also learned techniques to manage his energy level while dressing, bathing and preparing meals. The dietary and clinical team helped Russell work on lifestyle changes such as diet and managing stress.
Back to Active:



'After my heart attack I wanted to get back to my life and my own home, but I was very fearful about returning home on my own so I opted to transition in a skilled nursing center. After my rehab stay, I am back home and comfortable being on my own and taking care of myself. I can safely walk up and down my steps and I know what I need to do to help prevent another heart attack.' - Russell



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quote: "I didn't know that I would need short-term rehab, but I realized right away that the team was going to get me safely home."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Lyle's Complex Medical Recovery Story











Patient Profile:
Lyle, 68, underwent a below the knee amputation due to a diabetic foot ulcer infection. He had an extended hospital stay which made him weak and in need of strengthening, lifestyle training, pain management and wound care. 
Post-Acute Need:
Lyle lives with his wife and enjoys time with his children and grandchildren and had a goal to return home independently. He also needed help managing his diabetes and learning how to use his prosthesis. 
Post-Acute Stay: 
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Lyle meet his goals. He required wound care and pain management from the nursing team. Physical therapy worked with Lyle to help strengthen his leg and prepare him for his prosthesis. He also learned to walk with a walker and eventually a cane. Occupational therapy worked with Lyle on his daily activities such as getting in and out of the bathtub and using adaptive equipment. The team also worked on dietary modification to manage his diabetes and other lifestyle changes. 
Back to Active:



'I didn't know that I would need short-term rehab, but I realized right away that the team was going to get me safely home. I had a great experience and was definitely prepared to return home and back to my family.' - Lyle



Heartland, ManorCare and ProMedica skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal. Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quote: "The team kept me motivated and I can now walk and move my right hand and am now able to prepare the meals my family loves."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Nicole's Neurological Recovery Story











Patient Profile:
Nicole experienced a severe stroke at the age of 42. The stroke left Nicole somewhat unresponsive, unable to walk or take care of activities of daily living such as eating, drinking, bathing and dressing.
Post-hospital Need:
Before her stroke Nicole was an active woman who spent time cooking and caring for her family. Nicole was discouraged about her debilitated condition and worried that she would not be able to return home.
Post-hospital Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Nicole meet her goals. The team not only encouraged Nicole through her recovery they gave her the hope she needed to get back to her active life. Nicole's therapy team through the use of state-of-the-art equipment and techniques helped her regain strength and use of her extremities and worked with her on adjustments to her routines so she could prepare meals. The dietary team worked with Nicole on adjusting her diet.
Back to Active:



'I felt very hopeless and though I would never walk again. The team kept me motivated and I can now walk and move my right hand and am now able to prepare the meals my family loves. I have also learned how to better care for myself and change my bad habits.' - Nicole



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

careSettigns.careSettignsDescription:
Care Settings
Our Levels Of Caring
Our center is designed to give you the specific type of care you are looking for. Service levels include: 



Short-Term Care




Long-Term Care

shortTermCare.title: Short-Term Care
shortTermCare.content: Inpatient rehabilitation has shifted from hospitals to skilled nursing centers. Far from a traditional nursing home, our center is focused on recovery and getting you back into the community. Our specialists will work with you to help you return back to your lifestyle as quickly as possible.

longTermCare.title: Long-Term Care
longTermCare.content: We offer a variety of long-term residential options featuring varying levels of care and independence. Residents often come from the hospital, home or other community residences and need daily assistance. Our center is designed to provide gracious daily living and personal care in a homelike environment.
longTermCare.imageAlt: Nurse holding patient in loving manner.

treatmentExpertise.treatmentExpertiseDescription:
Treatment Expertise
Carefully Coordinated, Individualized Care
After a hospital stay, patients receive coordinated individualized care incorporating comprehensive medical services as well as a range of rehabilitation services designed to get the patient to a lower level of care.

amenities.amenitiesDescription:
Features & Amenities
Feel At Home
Emphasis in the design of our facilities is placed on providing optimum functionality in order to help you return home or to a lower level of care. During your care and rehabilitation, you will enjoy the use of state-of-the-art, modality-based rehabilitation equipment. Our center is designed to provide you with the finest in daily living and personal care in warm, comfortable surroundings.

diningOptions.title: Dining Options With Variety
diningOptions.content: Good nutrition is vital to your recovery. Our staff works to prepare well-balanced meals that can be modified to address a number of dietary needs. We have reduced-fat, low-calorie, high fiber and low-sodium options available. Snacks and substitute meals are also available.

activities.title: Activities
services: Religious services offered for various denominations
Sightseeing tours for viewing fall colors and holiday decorations

careTeam.careTeamDescription:
Care Team
Experience Matters
The expertise of the clinical and rehabilitation team can significantly impact your recovery success. Our comprehensive approach is designed to address your health needs as well as functional abilities, chronic illness and desired outcomes.

yourTeam.title: Your Care Team
yourTeam.description: Once you are admitted as a patient, you will be evaluated by an interdisciplinary team, including a certified rehabilitation and nursing staff trained to meet your special needs. Together, your team will create a regimen tailored just for you. You will use leading-edge equipment to aid in your rehabilitation. Throughout your stay, our team will monitor your care and report to your physician and managed health care plan. For return home, we may perform a home evaluation if needed and arrange for equipment and home care needs.
services: Registered and licensed nurses and nursing aides

champions.title: Our Champions Of Caring
champions.content: Each quarter, ProMedica Senior Care recognizes employees across the country for the  extraordinary care they provide. Get to know the individuals who make a real difference every day.

payment.paymentDescription:
Payment
Understanding Your Options
Our center is Medicare and Medicaid certified. In addition, we accept most managed care and commercial insurance, as well as private payment. Our admissions team will be happy to help with financial planning and understanding your options.
Make a Payment

options.title: Medicare
options.description: Medicare is a health insurance program for people 65 or older or people under 65 with certain disabilities or end-stage renal disease. Medicare doesn't cover all expenses and is not designed to pay for long-term custodial care, so it’s important to understand the program.

options.title: Medicare Advantage
options.description: Medicare Advantage plans offer traditional Medicare coverage along with additional services for preventative and early detection care. These plans provide coordinated care, combine all of the policies into one package and may have less expensive premiums than traditional coverage.

options.title: Medicaid
options.description: The Medicaid program provides medical benefits to low-income people who have no medical insurance or inadequate medical insurance. The federal government establishes the general guidelines for the program, but each state establishes the program’s requirements including eligibility. You can find out more about state information, or if an individual center is Medicaid certified, through our admissions office or by visiting medicaid.gov.

options.title: Managed Care And Insurance
options.description: Our center accepts most managed care or insurance plans for post-hospital care. We also work with auto insurance and workers' compensation claims. Our admissions team or case manager can help verify your provider benefits and explain your coverage. Our case managers are the liaison between the patient and insurance company to help coordinate health care needs.

options.title: Private Payment
options.description: For those patients who choose to make our center their home and do not qualify for Medicaid or other benefits, we accept private payment. Our admissions team can provide more information about our services and rate structure.

options.title: Admissions Policy
options.description: Our services are available to patients as prescribed by the physician or outlined in the care plan. When making the admission decision, we will admit and treat all persons without regard to race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, age, handicap, marital status or sexual preference. Each admission will be considered on an individual basis to determine whether the facility can meet the patient’s needs without jeopardizing the safety of other patients.

title: ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Monroe) - ProMedica Skilled Nursing & Rehabilitation

content.hospiceName: Welcome To ProMedica Skilled Nursing And Rehabilitation (Monroe)
content.title: Your Best Way Home
content.description: ProMedica Monroe Skilled Nursing and Rehab is an 89-bed facility that specializes in skilled nursing and post-hospital rehabilitation due to physical limitations or chronic conditions. Our experienced professionals help you gain the skills and strength you need to achieve a better quality of life and return home as quickly as possible. Just 1.5 miles from ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital, you have access to general and acute hospital care and emergency services as needed, as well as a wide variety of medical services.

title: ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Sylvania - ProMedica Skilled Nursing & Rehabilitation

content.hospiceName: Welcome To ProMedica Skilled Nursing And Rehabilitation (Sylvania)
content.title: Your Best Way Home
content.description: ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation is conveniently located on the ProMedica Flower campus. ProMedica is dedicated to providing individualized, quality post-hospital care you need in a warm and comfortable environment.

featuresAmenities.content: Emphasis in the design of our facilities is placed on providing optimum functionality in order to help you return home or to a lower level of care.

testimonials.quoteTitle: VICTORIA'S RECOVERY STORY AT PROMEDICA SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION (SYLVANIA, OH)
testimonials.quote: "I would recommend ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation to anyone who is looking for great care." - Victoria
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Victoria's Recovery Story at ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Sylvania, OH)












Victoria had previously been to ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Sylvania, OH) after a respiratory failure and chose to come back after she needed a pacemaker placed.


“I was admitted to ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation in 2021 after a hospital stay for respiratory failure. I was treated with kindness and respect by the entire team. They helped me with every need and looked after me while I was there for rehabilitation. The employees paid attention to small details and went the extra mile to make sure I could meet all of my goals. Because of this, when I had a pacemaker placed in 2022 and needed rehabilitation again, I chose to return and received the same great care. I can’t thank the employees enough for all their care and hard work to help me return home not once, but twice.”  - Victoria

testimonials.quote: "I was terrified and completely out of my comfort zone, but I can't say enough about how amazing everyone is here."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Brandi's Complex Medical Recovery Story at Heartland at ProMedica









Patient Profile:
Bandi is an active mother and wife who injured herself at her daughter's birthday party while playing basketball. At first she thought her back pain would go away, but when she started having migraines, Brandi went to the emergency room and discovered she would need rehabilitative therapists before going home.
Post-Acute Need:
 Brandi was in need of physical and occupational therapy to help her get back to an active lifestyle quickly and safely after her hospitalization. She required a skilled nursing facility that could help treat her recent diagnosis of transverse myelitis, an inflammation of her spinal cord.
Post-Acute Stay:
 As a young woman, Brandi never dreamt she would be told she needed to admit to a skilled nursing facility for rehab. Once she arrived at Heartland at ProMedica, everyone - from the aides, nurses and other therapy staff - helped Brandi accomplish her goal of returning home safely to her husband and daughter.
Back to Active:



'I was terrified and completely out of my comfort zone, but I can't say enough about how amazing everyone is here. Heartland at ProMedica is a pretty awesome place!' - Brandi

testimonials.quote: Peggy admitted to MedBridge at Heartland for comprehensive skilled nursing and intensive therapy following a hospitalization.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Peggy's Recovery Story at MedBridge at Heartland at ProMedica










'When I began retaining fluid, becoming tired from walking very short distances and not being able to think clearly, I knew something was wrong and I contacted my doctor right away. My doctor ran a few tests and found that I and an atrial insufficiency and congestive heart failure. I ended up needing an atrial valve replacement and was hospitalized for six days.




I was too weak to go home after being in bed for almost a week, so I chose to go to MedBridge at Heartland at ProMedica for rehabilitation. The amount of attention I received from the entire staff, from the doctor and nurse practitioner, to the nurses and aides, to the therapists, and even the dietary staff, was impeccable. They all worked cohesively with my cardiologist to make sure I was strong and healthy enough to go home safely. I felt so confident and well prepared to return back to my day-to-day routine! The rapport between the patients and staff is amazing. That is what this experience is all about - the people. I would recommend Heartland at ProMedica to anyone in need of short-term rehab - it's hands down the best in town!




They have it all at Heartland at ProMedica; the people, the experience, the knowledge and the comfort of home!' - Peggy

careSettigns.careSettignsDescription:
Care Settings
Our Levels Of Caring
Our center is designed to give you the specific type of care you are looking for. Service levels include: 



MedBridge: Dedicated Short-Term Care




Long-Term Care

shortTermCare.title: MedBridge: Dedicated Short-Term Care
shortTermCare.content: MedBridge is a separate and distinct unit within our skilled nursing center, designed to meet your needs: short-stay rehabilitation patients transitioning from hospital to home. Specialized staff, including registered nurses knowledgeable in post-acute care, provide medical and rehabilitative support, oversee clinical care and are focused on returning you back to your lifestyle. Our skilled nursing centers must meet specific criteria to earn the MedBridge name.

longTermCare.title: Long-Term Care
longTermCare.content: We offer a variety of long-term residential options featuring varying levels of care and independence. Residents often come from the hospital, home or other community residences and need daily assistance. Our center is designed to provide gracious daily living and personal care in a homelike environment.

You can find out more about state information, or if an individual center is Medicaid certified, through our admissions office or by visiting medicaid.gov.

options.title: Managed Care And Insurance
options.description: Our center accepts most managed care or insurance plans for post-hospital care. We also work with auto insurance and workers' compensation claims. Our admissions team or case manager can help verify your provider benefits and explain your coverage. Our case managers are the liaison between the patient and insurance company to help coordinate health care needs.

options.title: Private Payment
options.description: For those patients who choose to make our center their home and do not qualify for Medicaid or other benefits, we accept private payment. Our admissions team can provide more information about our services and rate structure.

options.title: Admissions Policy
options.description: Our services are available to patients as prescribed by the physician or outlined in the care plan. When making the admission decision, we will admit and treat all persons without regard to race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, age, handicap, marital status or sexual preference. Each admission will be considered on an individual basis to determine whether the facility can meet the patient’s needs without jeopardizing the safety of other patients.

testimonials.quoteTitle: MEMORY CARE CENTER HELPS WITH RESIDENT'S HEART’S DESIRE HELICOPTER TOUR
testimonials.quote: The team at ProMedica Goerlich Memory Care Center helped to make resident's 90th birthday Heart's Desire special.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Memory Care Center helps with Resident's Heart’s Desire Helicopter Tour












 
Marilyn, a resident at ProMedica Goerlich Memory Care Center, recently turned 90 years old and was surprised with an experience of a lifetime for her Heart’s Desire.
Marilyn has always loved adventures and doing thrilling activities such as white water rafting and riding in a hot air balloon, just to name a few. Her daughter, Rhonda, took her to lunch one day and they talked about what she would like to do for her 90th birthday. Marilyn stated she would like to ride in a helicopter after seeing a sign outside the restaurant about helicopter tours.
Rhonda and her husband Ed made plans to make Marilyn’s wish come true for her 90th birthday and booked a helicopter tour of Toledo, OH. The team wanted to help make Marilyn’s day special and got her an aviator jacket, scarf and hat to wear while in the air. The day came for Marilyn’s helicopter tour, Rhonda and Ed rode with Marilyn to experience this thrilling adventure with her. Marilyn loved every minute of the tour and seeing the beautiful fall colors and all the sights of Toledo.
When asked how she liked the helicopter ride, Marilyn stated, “I felt like I was dreaming!”

testimonials.quote: "I am now stronger and more flexible and able to walk on my own safely."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Kathleen's Orthopedic Recovery Story









Patient Profile: 
After a serious accident, Kathleen was admitted to the hospital. She was was severely injured with several broken bones that required surgery. Post-surgery, Kathleen was unable to walk or transfer and was in need of rehabilitation and nursing care before returning home.
Post-acute Need:
Kathleen, 74, lives on her own and gardens extensively. She required physical and occupational therapy to help get her strong enough to transfer and walk on her own. She was in severe pain and had surgical incisions that required care.
Post-acute Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Kathleen meet her goals. The nursing team helped Kathleen manager her pain and taught her about caring for her incisions. The therapy team helped Kathleen work on strengthening, balance and range of motion so she would feel confident returning home. The team did a home assessment to ensure Kathleen was confident in her ability to get around on her own.
Back to Active:



'When I first arrived I wasn't able to do much on my own. It was important to me to be able to get around independently since I was doing everything for myself before my accident. I am now stronger and more flexible and able to walk on my own safely.' - Kathleen



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quoteTitle: RIBBON TYING CEREMONY AT PROMEDICA SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION
testimonials.quote: Learn more about ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare at Arlington Heights, IL) and the ribbon tying ceremony with Mayor Tom Hayes and other community leaders.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Ribbon Tying Ceremony at ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation












 
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare at Arlington Heights, IL) held a ribbon “tying” ceremony with members of the community including the Village of Arlington Heights and the Chamber of Commerce. The team at ProMedica looks forward to being a resource for the community.
“Thank you for including me in your rebranding ceremony and for being part of our community. I was truly impressed by the quality and commitment of the employees at ProMedica,” stated Mayor Tom Hayes.
Watch the video below to learn more about the ribbon tying ceremony and to learn more about what it means to be part of ProMedica.

testimonials.quoteTitle: PATRICIA’S RECOVERY STORY AT PROMEDICA SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION (ARLINGTON HEIGHTS, IL)
testimonials.quote: "I am very grateful and happy for the wonderful care I received at ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation." – Patricia
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Patricia’s Recovery Story at ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Arlington Heights, IL)












 
Patricia transitioned to ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation following her hospital stay due to kidney issues.



'I was admitted to Northwest Community Hospital because I have a problem with my kidneys and I missed two of my dialysis treatments due to transportation issues. I live in Palatine, IL and I had to wait for the township bus to take me to the dialysis center. Prior to my discharge from the hospital, I did research for a place that offered in-house dialysis. I am very thankful that I found ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation.




I love ProMedica because the on-site dialysis is very convenient and they have a very friendly atmosphere. I especially love Hannah, she was very nice and caring. I am very grateful and happy for the wonderful care I received at ProMedica.' – Patricia

testimonials.quoteTitle: 14 PROMEDICA SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION CENTERS NAMED 2021-22 BEST NURSING HOME FOR SHORT-TERM REHABILITATION AND LONG-TERM CARE BY U.S. NEWS & WORLD REPORT
testimonials.quote: Learn how 14 of our skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers earned 2021-22 Best Nursing Homes for Short-Term Rehabilitation and Long-Term Care from U.S. News & World Report.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
14 ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Centers Named 2021-22 Best Nursing Home for Short-Term Rehabilitation and Long-Term Care by U.S. News & World Report



























 
14 of ProMedica’s skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers have been recognized as 2021-22 Best Nursing Home for Short-Term Rehabilitation and Long-Term Care by U.S. News & World Report. The centers earned Best Nursing Homes status by achieving a rating of “High Performing,” the highest possible rating, for Short-Term Rehabilitation and Long-Term Care. U.S. News gives the designation of Best Nursing Home only to those homes that satisfy U.S. News’s assessment of the appropriate use of key services and consistent performance in quality measures.
“We are proud of our centers that were identified as one of the best skilled nursing centers in the country. Our employees are dedicated to helping our patients and residents’ transition successfully from hospital to home, a critical step in a successful recovery. These awards illustrate the core of our mission-based organization, which is to improve the health and well-being of our patients, residents and the community,” said Angela Brandt, President of ProMedica Senior Care.
Centers that earned Best Nursing Homes status for both Short-Term Rehabilitation and Long-Term Care:
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare Health Services – Boulder)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare Health Services - Cedar Rapids)
ManorCare Health Services - Citrus Heights
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare Health Services - Fair Oaks)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare Health Services – Potomac)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare Health Services - Salmon Creek)
ManorCare Health Services – Sunnyvale
ManorCare Health Services - Tice Valley
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Rossmoor) (formerly ManorCare Health Services - Walnut Creek)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare Nursing and Rehabilitation Center – Kingsford)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare of Arlington Heights)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (formerly ManorCare of Palos Heights West)
ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (North Hills)
ProMedica Total Rehab + (formerly ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation – Willow Grove)
Now in its 12th year, the U.S. News Best Nursing Homes ratings and profiles offer comprehensive information about care, safety, health inspections, staffing and more for nearly all of the nation’s 15,000-plus nursing homes. The Best Nursing Homes ratings reflect U.S. News’ exclusive analysis of publicly available data using a methodology defined by U.S. News that evaluates factors that it has determined most greatly impact patient and resident care, safety, and outcomes. This year, to accompany the new ratings, nursing home profile pages were updated to include staff and resident COVID-19 vaccination rates.
“U.S. News takes pride in providing relevant, up-to-date information when making any sort of health care decision,” says Zach Adams, health data engineer at U.S. News. “Profiles now include resident and staff COVID-19 vaccination rates alongside information on how to pay for a facility. This important information can help families, residents and caregivers make a decision that keeps safety and accessibility at the highest priority.”
The Best Nursing Home finder features ratings on both long-term and short-term care. The Long-Term Care Rating aims to provide prospective residents who need help with daily activities, and their families, with analysis and information regarding the quality of care provided by nursing homes. The rating includes data on staffing, success in preventing ER visits and COVID-19 vaccination rates, among other metrics. The Short-Term Rating incorporates measures of quality including consistency of registered nurse staffing, use of antipsychotic drugs and success in preventing falls.
For more information behind both U.S. News ratings please refer to the FAQ.

testimonials.quoteTitle: STARLENE'S ORTHOPEDIC RECOVERY STORY AT MEDBRIDGE AT MANORCARE AT ARLINGTON HEIGHTS
testimonials.quote: "Now, I able to walk again thanks to all the staff at ManorCare, and I feel much stronger and I feel more independent."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Starlene's Orthopedic Recovery Story at MedBridge at ManorCare at Arlington Heights











Starlene admitted to MedBridge at ManorCare for skilled nursing and intensive therapy following foot surgery.













'I came to MedBridge at ManorCare at Arlington Heights after I had surgery on my foot at Northwest Community Hospital. I wasn’t able to walk on my foot after surgery. I was very weak, and in a wheelchair at all times. Now, I able to walk again thanks to all the staff at ManorCare, and I feel much stronger and I feel more independent. The physical therapy and occupational therapy teams have helped me improve my balance to walk again. I set a goal with the physical therapy team to walk up twenty-eight stairs, and I accomplished that goal. Also, I am able to walk four hundred and fifty feet. I could only walk twenty to thirty feet when I first arrived at ManorCare. I am very proud of my accomplishments and I would like to thank all the staff for helping me during this journey. Everyone at ManorCare has been so friendly and Cindy, my nurse, goes above and beyond for me. Christian, physical therapist, is always smiling and motivates me to accomplish my goals.'
'I am very happy I chose ManorCare, and I am very excited to feel independent again at home.' – Starlene, MedBridge at ManorCare Patient

recognitions.title: Recognized as one of US News Best Nursing Homes
recognitions.content: US News & World Report, an authority in health care rankings, evaluated more than 15,000 homes nationwide. ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation (Arlington Heights) is honored to be a recipient of the Best Nursing Homes of 2018-2019 award for achieveing high performance in short and long-term care.

Our skilled nursing centers must meet specific criteria to earn the MedBridge name.

testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Suhad's Recovery Story at MedBridge at Marvin & Betty Danto Health Care Center









Suhad admitted to MedBridge at Marvin & Betty Danto for extensive rehabilitation to regain her ability to walk.



'When I came to MedBridge at Marvin & Betty Danto Health Care Center, I had already given up on the thought that I would walk again. But the staff, from teh administration to housekeeping, were very optimistic and motivated me to push myself to get stronger. They gave me the confidence that I needed to walk again! As a matter of fact, I never missed a day in therapy. I am so happy I was able to maximize my therapy as I made so much progress!




My gratitude to the Marvin & Betty Danto staff is nothing compared to my experience, being here changed my life!' - Suhad

testimonials.quoteTitle: SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION EMPLOYEE COMMITMENT TO HELP THE ALZHEIMER'S ASSOCIATION
testimonials.quote: Read our employee Sharon’s story and her commitment to help the Alzheimer’s Association in its search for a cure.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Employee commitment to help the Alzheimers Association












Sharon Daring has worked at ManorCare Health Services – West Allen (PA) for over 20 years. She started her career in the memory care unit as a CNA. When Sharon’s mother, father and sister were diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease, it became challenging to not only care for her family members but also the patients and residents at the center. She decided to work in housekeeping to still be there for the patients and residents, just in a different role.
Sharon has a personal connection to the Alzheimer’s Association, as her mother, father and sister all passed away with Alzheimer’s disease. This created a strong desire for her to do whatever she could to help the Alzheimer’s Association in its search for a cure. Sharon got involved with the Alzheimer’s Association 7 years ago after her father passed away. She has been a long-time participant in the Walk to End Alzheimer’s in the Lehigh Valley community.
Due to the pandemic last year, the Walk to End Alzheimer’s became a virtual event. Sharon participated in the virtual walk and honored her loved ones, patients and residents by walking laps around the center. She also saved all of her overtime to donate $5,806 to the Alzheimer’s Association Walk to End Alzheimer’s.
Sharon received two awards from the Alzheimer’s Association along with a letter from Lori Wehr, walk manager at Alzheimer’s Association. She received the 2020 Top Frontline Hero and the 2020 Top National Team. In the letter, Lori stated, 
“Our Frontline Hero award was given to only one recipient in 2020 and was a special recognition that had never been awarded before. Your efforts to support the Walk while working on the front lines makes you truly a hero.”

testimonials.quoteTitle: CAROLYN'S STROKE RECOVERY & LONG-TERM CARE STORY AT MANORCARE HEALTH SERVICES - WEST ALLEN
testimonials.quote: "Upon completion of my therapy I felt empowered to complete my self-care independently."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Carolyn's Stroke Recovery & Long-Term Care Story at ManorCare Health Services - West Allen










'After suffering a stroke while at work, I was hospitalized for approximately five weeks where I needed to relearn how to use my arms and legs. I discharged from the hospital to my cousin’s home. I needed to adjust to living in someone else’s home and often felt I had lost my independence and privacy. With a lot of encouragement from my family, I was able to move into my own apartment after living with my cousin for a year.




Unfortunately, while living on my own, I collapsed and was hospitalized. During my hospital stay Dr. Martin referred me to ManorCare Health Services - West Allen. Initially I questioned the need for skilled nursing care. I remember that I was very scared, and I prayed a lot. While receiving post-acute care at ManorCare - West Allen, I worked with the therapy team to improve my strength, coordination and balance.




Upon completion of my therapy I felt empowered to complete my self-care independently.  While I have family that want me to come live with them, I like my independence and privacy and respect theirs as well. For that reason, I chose to make ManorCare – West Allen my home about five years ago.  I look forward to someday returning to my own apartment but for now living at ManorCare gives me piece-of-mind. I anticipate the day the pandemic is over, and we can all enjoy the world again. But for now, I feel I’m in the safest place in the world.




I definitely recommend ManorCare - West Allen mainly because of the skilled nursing and therapy care.' - Carolyn, ManorCare Resident

careTeam.careTeamDescription:
Care Team
Experience Matters
The expertise of the clinical and rehabilitation team can significantly impact your recovery success. Our comprehensive approach is designed to address your health needs as well as functional abilities, chronic illness and desired outcomes.

yourTeam.title: Your Care Team
yourTeam.description: Once you are admitted as a patient, you will be evaluated by an interdisciplinary team, including a certified rehabilitation and nursing staff trained to meet your special needs. Together, your team will create a regimen tailored just for you. You will use leading-edge equipment to aid in your rehabilitation. champions.title: Our Champions Of Caring
champions.content: Each quarter, ProMedica Senior Care recognizes employees across the country for the  extraordinary care they provide. Get to know the individuals who make a real difference every day.

payment.paymentDescription:
Payment
Understanding Your Options
Our center is Medicare and Medicaid certified. In addition, we accept most managed care and commercial insurance, as well as private payment. Our admissions team will be happy to help with financial planning and understanding your options.
Make a Payment

options.title: Medicare
options.description: Medicare is a health insurance program for people 65 or older or people under 65 with certain disabilities or end-stage renal disease. Medicare doesn't cover all expenses and is not designed to pay for long-term custodial care, so it’s important to understand the program.

options.title: Medicare Advantage
options.description: Medicare Advantage plans offer traditional Medicare coverage along with additional services for preventative and early detection care. These plans provide coordinated care, combine all of the policies into one package and may have less expensive premiums than traditional coverage.

options.title: Medicaid
options.description: The Medicaid program provides medical benefits to low-income people who have no medical insurance or inadequate medical insurance. The federal government establishes the general guidelines for the program, but each state establishes the program’s requirements including eligibility. You can find out more about state information, or if an individual center is Medicaid certified, through our admissions office or by visiting medicaid.gov.

options.title: Managed Care And Insurance
options.description: Our center accepts most managed care or insurance plans for post-hospital care. We also work with auto insurance and workers' compensation claims. Our admissions team or case manager can help verify your provider benefits and explain your coverage. Our case managers are the liaison between the patient and insurance company to help coordinate health care needs.

options.title: Private Payment
options.description: For those patients who choose to make our center their home and do not qualify for Medicaid or other benefits, we accept private payment. Our admissions team can provide more information about our services and rate structure.

options.title: Admissions Policy
options.description: Our services are available to patients as prescribed by the physician or outlined in the care plan. When making the admission decision, we will admit and treat all persons without regard to race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, age, handicap, marital status or sexual preference. Each admission will be considered on an individual basis to determine whether the facility can meet the patient’s needs without jeopardizing the safety of other patients.

testimonials.quoteTitle: SKILLED NURSING AND REHABILITATION CENTERS EARN 2021 BRONZE COMMITMENT TO QUALITY AWARD
testimonials.quote: Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Centers recognized as recipients of the 2021 Bronze - Commitment to Quality Award by the American Health Care Association and National Center for Assisted Living for their commitment to improving the lives of residents through quality care.
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Centers Earn 2021 Bronze Commitment to Quality Award












ProMedica Senior Care is pleased to have its skilled nursing and rehabilitation centers throughout the country recognized as recipients of the 2021 Bronze – Commitment to Quality Award by the American Health Care Association and National Center for Assisted Living (AHCA/NCAL) for their commitment to improving the lives of residents through quality care. The distinction is the first of three progressive award levels through the AHCA/NCAL National Quality Award Program. The program, presented by the leading association in long term and post-acute care, honors association members across the country that have demonstrated their commitment to improving quality of care for seniors and people with disabilities.
The American Health Care Association and National Center for Assisted Living (AHCA/NCAL) represents more that 14,000 non-profit and proprietary skilled nursing centers, assisted living communities, sub-acute centers and homes for individuals with intellectual and development disabilities. By delivering solutions for quality care, AHCA/NCAL aims to improve the lives of the nearly 5 million seniors and individuals with disabilities who receive long term or post-acute care in our facilities each year.
We are happy to announce the following centers who have earned the 2021 Bronze – Commitment to Quality Award:
ManorCare Health Services – Wilmington (DE)
Heartland Health Care & Rehabilitation Center – Sarasota (FL)
ManorCare Health Services At Lely Palms (FL)
ManorCare Health Services – Delray (FL)
ManorCare Health Services – Dubuque (IA)
ManorCare Health Services – Palos Heights West (IL)
Heartland Health Care Center – Briarwood (MI)
ManorCare Nursing & Rehabilitation Center (Kingsford, MI)
ManorCare Health Services – West Deptford (NJ)
Heartland Health Care Center – Greenville West (SC)
 
Bronze – Commitment to Quality Award applicants are able to describe their mission, characteristics, and key challenges and to recognize the relationship of these factors to their ability to achieve performance improvement. The Bronze Award recognizes the provider for developing a foundation to begin a journey of continuous quality improvement, and does not necessarily correspond to any public measure of performance.
The AHCA/NCAL National Quality Award Program is a progressive, three-step process that encourages the continuous learning, development, and execution of integrated quality systems to achieve performance excellence. Each progressive step requires a more detailed and comprehensive demonstration of quality integration and performance. The criteria for each step is based on the Baldrige Performance Excellence Program.
Congratulations to our centers on their achievements to receive this award!
https://www.ahcancal.org/Quality/National-Quality-Award-Program/Pages/default.aspx

testimonials.quoteTitle: WORDS OF APPRECIATION FOR MANORCARE HEALTH SERVICES AT LELY PALMS
testimonials.quote: "We are not sure if we have the proper words to express the appreciation our family feels for the kindness and care you showed our Mother at Lely Palms."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Words of Appreciation for ManorCare Health Services at Lely Palms










How do you begin to thank a staff of people who most assuredly extended our Mom's life? We are not sure if we have the proper words to express the appreciation our family feels for the kindness and care you showed our Mother.




Our Mother, Josephine, quietly passed away during her sleep on April 24, 2015 at the age of 96. She began her journey of life with HCR ManorCare a few years ago as a resident of the independent living facility and subsequently moved to the ManorCare @ Lely Palms facility on March 6, 2014. Her entire stay in both facilities was marked by an exemplary level of care and kindness that should be the example of what other facilities follow and what families should expect from all elderly care facilities.




There are very many people that we would like to mention as having touched our Mother's life, and although we cannot name them all, we hold them in high regard and thank them also. We would like to call your attention to a few people who showed the type of attention and care that we are talking about. In no particular order they are Maribel, Mitch, Giovanni, Tara, Marie and Jeurgen. These are but a few of the wonderful people who touched Mom's life. Your administrators, doctors, nurses, CNAs, physical therapists, social directors and even the custodians are a credit to the challenge that is elderly care.




We are hopeful that Mom touched their lives, as much as they touched hers.

title: ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation at MetroHealth - ProMedica Skilled Nursing & Rehabilitation

content.hospiceName: Welcome To ProMedica Skilled Nursing And Rehabilitation At MetroHealth
content.title: Your Best Way Home
content.description: Located in the newly renovated MetroHealth Old Brooklyn Campus, ProMedica Skilled Nursing and Rehabilitation Center at MetroHealth is a joint venture between ProMedica  and MetroHealth. This joint venture is one of the first in the nation - bringing together two health care systems to create a unique 96-bed state-of-the-art skilled nursing facility within a renovated hospital focused on the needs of older adults. The center provides comprehensive medical and intensive rehabilitation services for patients transitioning form hospital to home. For ease of access we suggest parking on level 3 of the garage located off Devonshire Road where you will find a walkway which leads to the center.

featuresAmenities.content: Emphasis in the design of our facilities is placed on providing optimum functionality in order to help you return home or to a lower level of care.

testimonials.quote: "I am now stronger and more flexible and able to walk on my own safely."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Kathleen's Orthopedic Recovery Story











Patient Profile: 
After a serious accident, Kathleen was admitted to the hospital. She was was severely injured with several broken bones that required surgery. Post-surgery, Kathleen was unable to walk or transfer and was in need of rehabilitation and nursing care before returning home.
Post-acute Need:
Kathleen, 74, lives on her own and gardens extensively. She required physical and occupational therapy to help get her strong enough to transfer and walk on her own. She was in severe pain and had surgical incisions that required care.
Post-acute Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Kathleen meet her goals. The nursing team helped Kathleen manager her pain and taught her about caring for her incisions. The therapy team helped Kathleen work on strengthening, balance and range of motion so she would feel confident returning home. The team did a home assessment to ensure Kathleen was confident in her ability to get around on her own.
Back to Active:



'When I first arrived I wasn't able to do much on my own. It was important to me to be able to get around independently since I was doing everything for myself before my accident. I am now stronger and more flexible and able to walk on my own safely.' - Kathleen



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quote: "After my rehab stay, I am back home and comfortable being on my own and taking care of myself."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Russell's Cardiac Recovery Story











Patient Profile:
Russell is a 68 year old male with a history of heart disease. After experiencing a heart attack, Russell underwent heart surgery. His doctor recommended post-acute skilled nursing and rehabilitation services before returning home.
Post-hospital Need:
Russell lives on his own in a split level house and was independent before his heart attack. He needed strengthening to climb his steps safely and make lifestyle adjustments. He also needed to improve his ability to care for his daily needs such as preparing meals, dressing and bathing.
Post-hospital Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Russell meet his goals. The nursing team took care of Russell's wound, taught him about wound care and medication management. The therapy team worked with Russell to regain strength so he could use the steps at home. He also learned techniques to manage his energy level while dressing, bathing and preparing meals. The dietary and clinical team helped Russell work on lifestyle changes such as diet and managing stress.
Back to Active:



'After my heart attack I wanted to get back to my life and my own home, but I was very fearful about returning home on my own so I opted to transition in a skilled nursing center. After my rehab stay, I am back home and comfortable being on my own and taking care of myself. I can safely walk up and down my steps and I know what I need to do to help prevent another heart attack.' - Russell



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quote: "I didn't know that I would need short-term rehab, but I realized right away that the team was going to get me safely home."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Lyle's Complex Medical Recovery Story











Patient Profile:
Lyle, 68, underwent a below the knee amputation due to a diabetic foot ulcer infection. He had an extended hospital stay which made him weak and in need of strengthening, lifestyle training, pain management and wound care. 
Post-Acute Need:
Lyle lives with his wife and enjoys time with his children and grandchildren and had a goal to return home independently. He also needed help managing his diabetes and learning how to use his prosthesis. 
Post-Acute Stay: 
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Lyle meet his goals. He required wound care and pain management from the nursing team. Physical therapy worked with Lyle to help strengthen his leg and prepare him for his prosthesis. He also learned to walk with a walker and eventually a cane. Occupational therapy worked with Lyle on his daily activities such as getting in and out of the bathtub and using adaptive equipment. The team also worked on dietary modification to manage his diabetes and other lifestyle changes. 
Back to Active:



'I didn't know that I would need short-term rehab, but I realized right away that the team was going to get me safely home. I had a great experience and was definitely prepared to return home and back to my family.' - Lyle



Heartland, ManorCare and ProMedica skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal. Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.

testimonials.quote: "The team kept me motivated and I can now walk and move my right hand and am now able to prepare the meals my family loves."
testimonials.quoteContent:
Experiences
Nicole's Neurological Recovery Story











Patient Profile:
Nicole experienced a severe stroke at the age of 42. The stroke left Nicole somewhat unresponsive, unable to walk or take care of activities of daily living such as eating, drinking, bathing and dressing.
Post-hospital Need:
Before her stroke Nicole was an active woman who spent time cooking and caring for her family. Nicole was discouraged about her debilitated condition and worried that she would not be able to return home.
Post-hospital Stay:
At the center, the interdisciplinary team created a care plan to help Nicole meet her goals. The team not only encouraged Nicole through her recovery they gave her the hope she needed to get back to her active life. Nicole's therapy team through the use of state-of-the-art equipment and techniques helped her regain strength and use of her extremities and worked with her on adjustments to her routines so she could prepare meals. The dietary team worked with Nicole on adjusting her diet.
Back to Active:



'I felt very hopeless and though I would never walk again. The team kept me motivated and I can now walk and move my right hand and am now able to prepare the meals my family loves. I have also learned how to better care for myself and change my bad habits.' - Nicole



Heartland-ManorCare skilled nursing centers provide a comprehensive regime of specialized rehabilitation services, each one designed to help you achieve your recovery goal.  Find a center near you to learn more about how a post-hospital stay can help you get back to active.
